uk.ac.man.cs.mig.util.graph.graph

Interface Node

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultNode, EllipticalNode, TriangularNode

    public interface Node
    User: matthewhorridge
    The Univeristy Of Manchester
    Medical Informatics Group
    Date: Dec 27, 2003

    matthew.horridge@cs.man.ac.uk
    www.cs.man.ac.uk/~horridgm

    The interface for Nodes contained in a Graph. A Node represents an object and manifests itself as a two dimensional shape, that can be renerered in a Graph. All basic Nodes have a position, a width and a height.
    See Also:
    Graph, Edge

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point getPosition()
      Gets the position of the Node.
      Shape getShape()
      Returns the Shape of the Node.
      Dimension getSize()
      Gets the size of the Node.
      Object getUserObject()
      Gets the userObject, previously set with setUserObject(Object o)
      void setPosition(int x, int y)
      Sets the (x,y) position of the Node.
      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the Node's size.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserObject

        Object getUserObject()
        Gets the userObject, previously set with setUserObject(Object o)
        Returns:
        The userObject, or null if no object has been set.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(int x,
                 int y)
        Sets the (x,y) position of the Node.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location.
        y - The vertical location.

      • getPosition

        Point getPosition()
        Gets the position of the Node.
        Returns:
        A Point containing the x,y position of the Node.

      • setSize

        void setSize(int width,
             int height)
        Sets the Node's size.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the Node.
        height - The height of the Node.

      • getSize

        Dimension getSize()
        Gets the size of the Node.
        Returns:
        A Dimension containing the width and height of the Node.

      • getShape

        Shape getShape()
        Returns the Shape of the Node.
        Returns:
        The Shape of the Node.
